_BACKEND: Please leave a space here to seperate the different sections of the translations.
main.errors_and_warnings: Errors and warnings in the log files:
main.crashed: ETS2LA has crashed with the following error:
main.send_report: Send the above traceback to the developers.
core.backend_started: ETS2LA backend has been started successfully.
immediate.message_error: An error occurred while processing a message.
immediate.empty_page: Tried to send an empty page.
webpage.ui_loading: Please wait while we initialize the user interface
sounds.missing_sound: Soundpack '{0}' is missing the required sound '{1}'
sounds.invalid_file_type: Soundpack '{0}' has an invalid file type '{1}'
sounds.sound_not_found_in_soundpack: Tried to play sound '{0}', but it was not found in soundpack '{1}'
logging.delete_log_error: Could not delete the log file.
_FRONTEND: Please leave a space here to seperate the different sections of the translations.
frontend.authentication.login_prompt: Please login or sign up to access the application.
frontend.authentication.account_creation: This will create a new account. Are you sure?
Don't have an account? Just type in your desired username and password and we will create one for you.
frontend.authentication.first_line_1: Yes, all features are free to use.
frontend.authentication.second_line_1: No, we do not collect any private data out of principle. I do not want to handle any private data of users, that is too big of a responsibility for me.
frontend.authentication.third: Why do I need an account?
frontend.authentication.third_line_1: You do not need an account to use the app. An account is only needed for the following free features.
frontend.authentication.third_line_1_2: Developer comments on feedback and support requests
frontend.authentication.third_line_1_3: Personal data portal for ETS2 data (see past deliveries etc...)
frontend.authentication.third_line_2: The app will still collect the ETS2 data without an account. But it will be appended to the public anonymous data portal instead of being tied to your account.
frontend.authentication.fourth: How do I delete my account?
frontend.authentication.fourth_line_1: This has not yet been implemented in app, for now please contact me on discord @Tumppi066 or email contact@tumppi066.fi
frontend.authentication.fifth: What data do you collect then?
frontend.authentication.fifth_line_1: We collect the following. Please note that this list includes everything that the app will collect 'in the worst case'. Most of these can be turned off in the settings!
frontend.authentication.fifth_line_1_1: Ping to the central server every 60s
frontend.authentication.fifth_line_1_4: ETS2 API data (see the following link for the github repository)
frontend.authentication.fifth_line_2: None of the data we collect can be traced back to you. The server doesn't log IPs, ETS2 usernames etc...
frontend.authentication.sixth: How are my login details stored on my device?
frontend.authentication.sixth_line_1: The app doesn't actually store your login details on device. In fact nowhere in the pipeline is your password stored as plain text. Instead the server provides your device with a login token.
frontend.authentication.sixth_line_2: This token is then stored in your browser's local storage. It is important to note that, even though this does protect your password, if someone get's hold of said token, they can log into your account.
frontend.pluginlist.name: Plugin QuickAccess™
frontend.404.title: Why are we here... just to suffer?
frontend.404.message: Anyway click the button below to return to the home screen, and can you please tell us how you got here?
_PLUGIN_SETTINGS: Please leave a space here to seperate the different sections of the translations.
global.settings.1.title: Global Settings
global.settings.1.description: These are mostly settings that affect the entire application.
global.settings.2.name: Soundpack
global.settings.2.description: The soundpack to use. These will change all the sounds for the app.
global.settings.3.name: Volume
global.settings.3.description: The volume of the sounds in the app.
global.settings.4.name: Frontend Port
global.settings.4.description: The port the frontend runs on.
global.settings.5.name: Fancy Traceback
global.settings.5.description: Whether to use a fancy traceback when an error occurs.
global.settings.6.name: Send Crash Reports
global.settings.6.description: Whether to send crash reports to the developers.
global.settings.7.name: Debug Mode
